result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry D Brewer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.  Receive job and vocational training.

No drugs unless prescribed.  No alcohol.
No firearms; weapons.
Particpate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all applicable costs, feees, assessments, surcharges including DNA surcharges.  To be paid while on probation.  Failure to pay is to convert to civil judgment that is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

records.addlTxt: /for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions, signed and filed.  Copy sent to agent and the District Attorney's Office.

Certification of Filing of Transcript. Original transcript (7 pages)  commencing PRELIMINARY HEARING 06/19/2014. Received and Filed. Copy of transcript forwarded to Urzula Tempska, PO Box 11213, Shorewoodm WI 53211-0213

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Moroney
for review. os

Defendant Jerry D Brewer in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
As to Count 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 11 days time served.  
As to Count 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 2 with credit for 0 days.
Sentences to run consecutive with an other sentence and consecutive to 13CM4947.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
      *   a mental health evaluation and treatment
      *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No drugs unless prescribed, no alcohol
     *   Obtain and maintain employment and or school
     *   receive job and vocational training
     *   anger management
     *   cognitive thinking counseling
     *   No firearms; weapons.
As to Count 2:  Court ordered 120 days condition time.  Court imposed and stayed 60 days to be used at the PO agent's discretion.  Defendant granted Huber for work, school and treatment for the 60 days condition time served.  Good time to apply.  Defendant's report date is 4-18-2014 at 5:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharges for Counts 2 & 3 while on probation to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargable in bankrutpcy.  Appeal rights given.
Filed with Court:    Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral form, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form, and medication list received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/from Justice Point, filed. rn

Defendant Jerry D Brewer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in  Counts 1 and 4.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Counts 1 and 4 dismissed but read in.  


AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant sworn, examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Victim notification needed. Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 4/11/14 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.

Defendant Jerry D Brewer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered all conditions of bail continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant's father to Judge Moroney.
/from Justice POint, filed. rn

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jerry D Brewer not in court.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Due to inclement weather, courts to be closed on 1/28/14.  New date selected with defense counsel of 2/18/14 at 1:30 p.m.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM002273  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/15/14 vf

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 
Defendant ordered not to possess ANY FIREARMS/DANGEROUS WEAPONS.

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  
Bail AMENDED TO A $500 CASH.

Defendant Jerry D Brewer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jerry D Brewer in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jerry D Brewer in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Jerry D Brewer in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 4.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
